decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through direct burn spells and aggressive creatures. Using efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast, along with repeatable damage from Thermo-Alchemist and Curse of the Pierced Heart, this deck aims to reduce the opponent's life total as quickly as possible. With a low mana curve and plenty of ways to deal damage, this aggressive burn deck is looking to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on using an aggressive strategy with Elves to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing mana acceleration with cards like Llanowar Elves and Priest of Titania, the deck aims to flood the board with creatures like Elvish Vanguard and Timberwatch Elf. It also includes cards like Lead the Stampede and Distant Melody to refill the hand and maintain pressure. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Essence Warden and Wellwisher provides some lifegain to sustain against opposing aggro decks. The deck's win condition is to buff its creatures with Timberwatch Elf and overwhelm the opponent with a large Elf army.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Glint Hawk and Kor Skyfisher to apply early pressure, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast to finish off opponents. The deck also includes cards like Palace Sentinels and Prismatic Strands to maintain card advantage and protect the board. Additionally, the deck incorporates artifact synergies with cards like Prophetic Prism and Alchemist's Vial to ensure consistent mana and card draw. The land base includes a mix of colored sources and utility lands to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's board while efficiently dealing damage with creatures and removal spells. It aims to control the game through targeted removal spells like Disfigure and Chainer's Edict, and gain card advantage with Sign in Blood and Phyrexian Rager. The deck also has key finishers like Gray Merchant of Asphodel and Thorn of the Black Rose to close out the game. With a mix of efficient creatures and disruption, this deck looks to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to swarm the board with low-cost creatures like Seeker of the Way, Squadron Hawk, and Thraben Inspector, while also utilizing cards like Battle Screech and Rally the Peasants to pump up your creatures and deal damage quickly. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Journey to Nowhere to control the board and keep your opponent on the defensive. Additionally, Prismatic Strands provides protection for your creatures while Palace Sentinels helps maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outlast opponents. The deck aims to efficiently deal with threats on the board while also using graveyard recursion with cards like Exhume to bring back powerful creatures like Gurmag Angler. It also includes cards like Augur of Bolas and Preordain to dig for key pieces and maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponent's plans and establish control over the game.

The key focus of this deck is to establish control through removal and disruption while steadily gaining incremental advantage with lifegain and card draw. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's board with removal spells like Chainer's Edict and Cast Down, while generating value with cards like Thorn of the Black Rose and Night's Whisper. By utilizing cards like Pestilence and Pristine Talisman for additional control and staying power, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind them out in a war of attrition.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan using a combination of counterspells like Counterspell and removal spells like Snuff Out. The deck aims to control the board state with counterspells and removal while generating card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Preordain. It also includes efficient creatures like Spellstutter Sprite and Ninja of the Deep Hours to pressure the opponent. Additionally, it utilizes cards like Gurmag Angler and Thorn of the Black Rose to close out the game once it has established control.

The deck maximizes the affinity mechanic by including artifact creatures and cheap artifacts to quickly flood the board with threats. The key concept is to utilize sacrifice effects like Atog and Fling to deal massive damage to the opponent in a short amount of time. The deck also includes card draw spells like Thoughtcast and Of One Mind to maintain resources and keep up the pressure. The inclusion of burn spells like Galvanic Blast helps to close out the game quickly if needed. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, counter magic, and card advantage. The deck aims to control the board with removal like Cast Down and Evincar's Justice while countering key spells with Counterspell and Exclude. It also utilizes card draw spells like Mystical Teachings and Think Twice to ensure it has answers to the opponent's threats. Additionally, the deck includes life gain sources like Pristine Talisman to ensure its sustainability in the late game.

The main focus of this deck is to use efficient removal spells and disruptive creatures to control the opponent's board and hand. With cards like Chainer's Edict, Terminate, and Lightning Bolt, along with creatures like Bone Picker and Liliana's Specter, the deck aims to take control of the game by removing threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw spells like Night's Whisper and Bonder's Ornament to maintain card advantage while utilizing cards like Thorn of the Black Rose to generate additional card advantage. Ultimately, the goal is to out-value and outlast the opponent through attrition and control.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using the Urza lands to generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful spells and creatures. The deck includes a mix of control elements such as removal spells and card draw, as well as big threats like Ulamog's Crusher to overpower opponents. The deck aims to control the game and disrupt opponents' strategies while ramping up to play its powerful creatures and finish the game with significant impact.

This UR Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It utilizes creatures like Augur of Bolas and Mulldrifter for card advantage, along with Archaeomancer to recur important spells. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Skred and Agony Warp to handle threats from the opponent. With a good amount of cantrips like Ponder and Preordain, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while out-valuing the opponent. The mana base includes a mix of snow-covered lands and Terramorphic Expanse for consistency.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost creatures and maximizing their efficiency with pump spells and combat tricks. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats, maintaining pressure and creating a fast clock. The deck's key strategy revolves around aggressive early-game plays and maintaining a board presence to finish off the opponent quickly before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of evasion creatures and removal spells helps to push through damage and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner and Thermo-Alchemist. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of direct damage from cards like Chain Lightning, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt while efficiently using resources with cards like Fireblast and Needle Drop. Searing Blaze is used to control the board while Curse of the Pierced Heart adds additional pressure. The deck is streamlined with a high number of burn spells and Mountains to ensure a fast and relentless assault.

The deck focuses on establishing Urzatron lands to generate a significant amount of mana and then control the game through a combination of counter spells, card draw, and recursion. It aims to outvalue the opponent by consistently casting powerful spells like Mulldrifter and Rolling Thunder, while also keeping the opponent at bay with Moment's Peace and Stonehorn Dignitary. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to continuously generate resources and control the board, leading to a strong late-game advantage.
